abstract: Zika virus has spread to Puerto Rico, turning struggling territory into United States' front line in looming epidemic; number of factors, including climate, living conditions and poor economy, make country perfect breeding ground for disease; CDC estimates quarter of island's 3.5 million people will get virus within year, and 80 percent or more may eventually become infected.
lead_paragraph: Intensive efforts to stop the virus have begun on the island, where a quarter of the population will get it within a year, the C.D.C. predicts.

headline.main: Puerto Rico Braces for Its Own Zika Epidemic
headline.print_headline: Puerto Rico Now U.S. Front Line as Zika Spreads

snippet: Intensive efforts to stop the virus have begun on the island, where a quarter of the population will get it within a year, the C.D.C. predicts.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
